title: DerekFlips
author: DerekFlips
content: Hello there, I've been wondering where to ask this question yet could not find any suiting place anyways.  Its been almost a year I've first started chasing these type of games and enjoying it so far. I wonder if there are any P2M P2E games worth attention? We could maybe share knowledge and even play together some of those games.  If this is not the fitting place for this question please do lead me to the one that is. Thank you in advance!

comments.author: Grim149x
comments.body: ill recomend dyor about dream quest Dreams Quest is a multi-stage game with the first chapter, Dreams Quest Origins, the Fall of Azoria, being the opening game that will allow players to experience the immersive game experience, to explore familiar landscapes and biomes, and to seek to understand what has happened to Azoria and what needs to be done to restore it. dyor about this project its good for long term

comments.author: Javi_Anibarro
comments.body: There are a lot of P2E games out there, it depends on your preference.If you are looking for FPS kind of project, Undeadblock might be suitable for you. Not only do they have a good community and development, but they are also running on a good platform IMMUTABLE X. The game is similar to left4dead, we are shooting zombies and getting their native token through it.If you are into strategy and turn-based games, you can try Splinterlands, GodUnchained, and Skyweaver. They have been in here for years and they never stop developing their project.

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: Quote from: DerekFlips on August 29, 2022, 01:46:42 PMHello there, I've been wondering where to ask this question yet could not find any suiting place anyways.  Its been almost a year I've first started chasing these type of games and enjoying it so far. I wonder if there are any P2M P2E games worth attention? We could maybe share knowledge and even play together some of those games.  If this is not the fitting place for this question please do lead me to the one that is. Thank you in advance! The market is down right now and these play-to-earn games have been hit badly and most of their tokens are very low right now. So if there are some worth our attention, it will depend on what you see with these projects. You need to DYOR and some projects that might have been told to you here could be the best for them but not suitable for you. Anyway, this is the right place for you to ask such questions, let the others have their suggestion and read what they think it's worth giving attention for the projects they will suggest.

comments.author: serjent05
comments.body: I do not know what kind of play-to-earn and play-to-mint game you are looking for but you can browse this site https://playtoearn.net/blockchaingames to look for possible games that you may get interested.  It is the list of play-to-earn games that shows the current status of the game.  It is quite helpful because almost all the games are listed there.

comments.author: o48o
comments.body: Quote from: DerekFlips on August 29, 2022, 01:46:42 PM...Its been almost a year I've first started chasing these type of games and enjoying it so far. I wonder if there are any P2M P2E games worth attention? We could maybe share knowledge and even play together some of those games.  ....Have you tried Gods Unchained? They have pretty much pioneered quality NFT gaming to the point they created ImmutableX to deal with tx fees for nfts. I think they are definitely worth looking at even though i have some personal issues with them, ton of communication issues during launch and deceiving technical bragging. I don't even need to understand the whole issue, i trust way more tech savvy coders than me on that. But i recon you get best experience for investing very small sums in any game and not try to free leech them. You can get so much more from them when you have skin in the game.

comments.author: samcrypto
comments.body: Quote from: serjent05 on August 29, 2022, 07:35:01 PMI do not know what kind of play-to-earn and play-to-mint game you are looking for but you can browse this site https://playtoearn.net/blockchaingames to look for possible games that you may get interested.  It is the list of play-to-earn games that shows the current status of the game.  It is quite helpful because almost all the games are listed there.The list of games are really interesting, it’s good to have this kind of site though as we can see, the market is not in a good position and looking at those P2E games, they are all down which can affect the earnings that you could get from them. I still see Axie to lead the P2E industry but then again, it’s not rewarding anymore. If you really want to play P2E OP, you must be ready to invest some money and have a lesser expectation that you could get your ROIA instantly, most probably it will take time.

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: I'm playing mmorpg Ni No Kuni. It's a free to play game at same time it's a pay to win game. You earn in-game tokens called Territe and Asterite by ranking among the top players and by killing respective monsters. Many players are complaining the game isn't profitable and only those who heavily invest on the game are able to earn by ranking on the top, while killing monsters doesn't worth the time spent for the earned rewards.I stiil don't have any conclusions about the game, but the lack of interest from players who want fast and easy money is a good sign. It helps filtrating the environment somehow. Moreover, bots aren't able to harm the economy, because they don't rank among top players and until they reach a high level where they could potentially have access to better drops the accounts will be spotted, banned and removed.Besides this game, i don't know any other alternatives right now which can provide players a full gaming experience.

comments.author: Yogee
comments.body: What games have you played so far? Probably just avoid games that says they are the next big thing or the "axie killers" and also those oracle-based games. They tend to die out first for some reason hehe. Maybe stay away from games that are overly hyped on social media by some of the so-called influencers who doesn't even know the game that well.

comments.author: X-ray
comments.body: It's very hard to pick some. I will try to pick some earning projects that were not forcing its users to owned some NFTs. Yeah it's very hard to calculate how much you will  get by playing it but at least this has some good things to be used to earn some money rather than wasting your money to earn nothing. The game like axie infinity is not giving you any money again. ROI was very very bad. It's better to stick into vulcan forged which is free to play and the economic of its token were stable without getting huge inflation like SLP. The play to earn token called lava already paired with several big tokens include USDC. These days move to earn was not so good as it was a few months ago. I think that you need to consider it again but renting shoes from others seems to be a good choice.

With that measure, developers removed a large portion of the players from the game as well, because they don't have teams strong enough to stay competitive on PVP mode. Theoretically after doing that SLP price would rise, but what we have seen since then was an even further drop in price. Unfortunatelly a sustainable recipe hasn't been discovered by developers yet to run their projects efficiently and to make it worth for players on long run.

comments.author: babygun
comments.body: I have always wondered if it would be really be interesting to play these kind of games. If you get early in, it can maybe be interesting but you also need to put a lot of time in. From the moment, some of the projects really grow like Axie, they always lower the rewards...

comments.author: X-ray
comments.body: There are so many that worthy to be played but the most difficult thing to search for some which were offering you good amounts of money. I guess so many people are searching for this but they were unable to calculate accurately how much they will earn from playing the game. I think that it's better if you can try to get the list and then join in the community to get information about how much money that offered by any play to earn game.

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: Axie still has the most users playing. If you are trying to look for alternatives try checking this list https://dappradar.com/rankings/category/gamesSo many games today are created on Polygon, BNB chain, WAX, Solana, and EOS. This is sort of an investment as well if you are rooting for its success, the stats you can find in the link will give you an idea about them also.

comments.author: poodle63
comments.body: I think that you shall focus with any move to earn project. This move to earn project will be so easy without you need to spend some of your time to play the game. You can do that even in your daily activities caused by it will be counting your move and run. it will convert it to be points that can be exchanged with the tokens. Im always using the app even the salary gets decreased but at least i can earn some bucks in a week for doing daily activities.

comments.author: bakasabo
comments.body: After cryptocurrency trends has moved from play to earn into move/walk/run to move, do playing games still profitable? Is Axie Infinity still profitable that much, so people quit jobs and concentrate on games? I am looking for an opinion of a decent player, that is not spending his whole day playing, or someone with unlimited funds, that has bought every booster in the game and now just sit, click one button and is bored.
